text: Kim Jin-hyeon (born 28 September 1999) is an South Korean professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for K League 1 side Gwangju on loan from Pohang Steelers. ==Club career== After going through the Pohang Steelers youth academy, Kim joined newly promoted K League 1 side Gwangju on loan for a season. He made his professional debut for the club on 9 May 2020 against Seongnam in which he started and played just 37 minutes before being substituted. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|Cup !colspan=2|Continental !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=1|Gwangju (loan) |2020 |K League 1||2||0||0||0||—||—||2||0 |- !colspan=3|Career total !2||0||0||0||0||0||2||0 |} ==References== ==External links== *Profile at the Gwangju FC website Category:1999 births Category:Living people Category:South Korean footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Pohang Steelers players Category:Gwangju FC players Category:K League 1 players
title: Kim Jin-hyeon (footballer, born 1999)
